title: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml to differentiate the two use cases. There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that. It is possible that jsvc may show the same behavior, but it has not been tested.
OB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service, Tomcat stops successfully but prints the following error message in the catalina.20100427.log: 27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServer SEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down. It is only a message and does not actually prevent Tomcat from stopping. After printing the message, Catalina stopServer() performs System.exit(1) which results in Tomcat shutdown. It appears that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, the Catalina server is not null.
EB: The error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' should not be printed in the log when using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service. Tomcat should stop successfully without any error messages in the log.
SR: 1. Configure server.xml with <Server port="1". 2. Start Tomcat using the Windows service. 3. Check the catalina.log file for any error messages related to the shutdown port configuration.
